p: Reagent and conditions are as follows: (a) K2CO3, DMF, substituted benzyl bromide or haloalkane, rt; (b) (1) NaH, DMF, CH3I, rt; (2) 5% NaOH, DMF, rt; (3) acid anhydrides, DMAP, THF or acid, DMAP, EDCI, DCM; (c) succinic anhydride, DMAP, CH2Cl2, rt, 24 h, 87–97%; (d) ClCH2COCH3, DMF, K2CO3, 60°C; (e) CH2Cl2, rt; (f) (1) NaBH4, CH3OH, 0°C; (2) Boc-amino acid, DCC, DMAP, CH2Cl2, rt; (g) (1) p-CH3C6H4SO3H, CH3OH, rt; (2) (C2H5)2O, dry HCl gas, 0°C, then NaHCO3aqueous solution; (h) chromic acid solution, acetone, 0°C, 1 h [ 114]; (i) (1) SiO2, Jonesreagent, acetone, 30 min, 0°C, 98%; (2) pyridiniumtribromide, AcOH, 2 h, 25°C, quant; (3) NaOH, DMF, inert gas, 0°C, quant; (4) NaBH4, MeOH, THF, 0°C, 1 h, 48% and 45% [ 115]; (j) Ac2O, TEA, DMAP, DCM, 25°C, 20 h, 76-78%; (k) (1) Diphenylphosphoryl azide, TEA, toluene, 180°C, 3 h, microwaves, 76%; (2) HClaq, THF, 30-50°C, 2-24 h, 76%; (3) phenylisocyanate, toluene, 2 h, 25°C, 69%; (l) DMF, K2CO3, room temp; (m) EDCI, DMAP, reflux, room temp; (n) (1) Ac2O, NEt3, DMAP, DCM, 88%; (2) oxalyl chloride, THF, DCM, piperazine 49%; (0) oxalyl chloride, THF; NEt3, DMAP,25°C, 2 h, 50%.
